intro: Byrsonima × horneana, commonly known as the hornean araçari, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Amazon rainforest and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces fleshy, orange-red fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
